value.title: DAX Fridays! #17: DATEDIFF
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to calculate the difference between two dates using DATEDIFF. I also show you how to overcome the issue when the start date is larger than the end date.  PREVIOUS VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ykkaAtlCMc NEXT VIDEO: -  Link to demo file: http://gofile.me/2kEOD/G4FzzQLvV

value.excerpt: Did you know that you can use a slicer in Power BI to highlight values instead of filtering them? value.title: DAX Fridays! #18: YTD,QTD, MTD
value.excerpt: Let's go through Year to date, Quater to date and Month to date functions available in DAX!  Keynotes: 00:26 TOTALYTD function in DAX 07:18 TOTALMTD function in DAX 11:22 TOTALQTD function in DAX  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/totalytd-dax   NEXT VIDEO:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ykkaAtlCMc

value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX?  This scenario is often called role playing dimensions and in this video I will show you two ways to solve it. :) Happy Friday!!  Links to videos mentioned: Introduction to data modeling:

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships. value.title: DAX Fridays! #44: CROSSFILTER
value.excerpt: IN todays video, we will go trough an example on how crossfilter works. Crossfilter can simulate relationships and active and deactivate them as you need to. value.title: DAX Fridays! #49: SELECTEDVALUE

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI with Extra Options   Summarize Function in DAX

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.

value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: In Power BI, there are multiple ways of searching for a text term inside a text field, you can use Power Query for doing this operation or calculations in DAX. In this video, I'll explain some functions in DAX that you can use to do this calculation. Most of these functions can be used inside a measure

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio

value.title: Calculate Totals for  MTD, QTD and YTD in DAX
